ExpenseTracker

Class Wallet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ExpenseTracker.Wallet

  • public class Wallet
extends java.lang.Object
    The Wallet class is a "state machine" that stores the user's current balance, savings and debt. It changes state and behaviour based on those variables.
    Author:
    Daniele Palazzo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double balance 
      double debt 
      double savings 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wallet(double balance, double savings, double debt)
      Construct a Wallet object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add_money(double amount)
      Add money to the balance.
      State get_state()
      Get the current state.
      State has_balance_state()
      Get the has_balance state which is a possible internal Wallet state.
      State has_saving_no_balance_state()
      Get the has_saving_no_balance state which is a possible internal Wallet state.
      State low_balance_state()
      Get the low_balance state which is a possible internal Wallet state.
      State no_saving_no_balance_state()
      Get the no_saving_no_balance state which is a possible internal Wallet state.
      void pay_off_debt_with_balance(double amount)
      Decrease debt using the Wallet balance.
      void pay_off_debt_with_savings(double amount)
      Decrease debt using the Wallet savings.
      void print_info(java.io.OutputStreamWriter os)
      Print out the current Wallet information ( current balance, savings and debt)
      void set_state(State state)
      Set the current state
      void spend_money(double amount)
      Spend money from the wallet (decrease balance and/or savings or increase debt) This will never throw an Insufficient funds exception because the debt can always be increased.
      void transfer_to_savings(double amount)
      Transfer money from the balance to the savings within the Wallet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wallet

        public Wallet(double balance,
              double savings,
              double debt)
        Construct a Wallet object.
        Parameters:
        balance - Amount of money that is available to spend.
        savings - Amount of money that is put away in savings.
        debt - Amount of money owed (e.g. loans, credit etc.)

    • Method Detail

      • add_money

        public void add_money(double amount)
               throws Invalid_amount_exception
        Add money to the balance.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to add to the balance.
        Throws:
        Invalid_amount_exception - This is thrown if the amount is not right. (negative value)

      • spend_money

        public void spend_money(double amount)
                 throws Invalid_amount_exception
        Spend money from the wallet (decrease balance and/or savings or increase debt) This will never throw an Insufficient funds exception because the debt can always be increased.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount to spend from the Wallet.
        Throws:
        Invalid_amount_exception - This is thrown if the amount is not right. (negative value)

      • transfer_to_savings

        public void transfer_to_savings(double amount)
                         throws Insufficient_funds_exception,
                                Invalid_amount_exception
        Transfer money from the balance to the savings within the Wallet.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to transfer.
        Throws:
        Insufficient_funds_exception - This is thrown if the amount is greater than the available balance.
        Invalid_amount_exception - This is thrown if the amount is not right. (negative value)

      • pay_off_debt_with_balance

        public void pay_off_debt_with_balance(double amount)
                               throws No_debt_exception,
                                      Invalid_amount_exception,
                                      Insufficient_funds_exception
        Decrease debt using the Wallet balance.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount to decrease debt by (from the balance).
        Throws:
        No_debt_exception - This is thrown if there is no debt to pay off
        Invalid_amount_exception - This is thrown if the amount is not right. (e.g. amount is greater than debt)
        Insufficient_funds_exception - This is thrown if the amount is greater than the Wallet balance

      • pay_off_debt_with_savings

        public void pay_off_debt_with_savings(double amount)
                               throws No_debt_exception,
                                      Invalid_amount_exception,
                                      Insufficient_funds_exception
        Decrease debt using the Wallet savings.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount to decrease debt by (from the savings).
        Throws:
        No_debt_exception - This is thrown if there is no debt to pay off.
        Invalid_amount_exception - This is thrown if the amount is not right. (e.g. amount is greater than debt)
        Insufficient_funds_exception - This is thrown if the amount is greater than the Wallet savings

      • get_state

        public State get_state()
        Get the current state.
        Returns:
        Return the current state.

        Parameters:

        Return the has_saving_no_balance state

        public State no_saving_no_balance_state()

        Return the no_saving_no_balance state

      • print_info

        public void print_info(java.io.OutputStreamWriter os)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Print out the current Wallet information ( current balance, savings and debt)
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
